examples: the article was a very good read

definitions.text: interpret something that is written or printed
examples: read the advertisement
Have you read Salman Rushdie?

definitions.text: have or contain a certain wording or form
examples: The passage reads as follows
What does the law say?

definitions.text: look at, interpret, and say out loud something that is written or printed
examples: The King will read the proclamation at noon
This dictionary can be read by the computer

definitions.text: interpret the significance of, as of palms, tea leaves, intestines, the sky; also of human behavior
examples: She read the sky and predicted rain
I can't read his strange behavior
The fortune teller read his fate in the crystal ball

definitions.text: interpret something in a certain way; convey a particular meaning or impression
examples: I read this address as a satire
How should I take this message?
You can't take credit for this!

definitions.text: be a student of a certain subject
examples: She is reading for the bar exam

definitions.text: indicate a certain reading; of gauges and instruments
examples: The thermometer showed thirteen degrees below zero
The gauge read `empty'

definitions.text: audition for a stage role by reading parts of a role
examples: He is auditioning for `Julius Caesar' at Stratford this year
I read you loud and clear!
She understands French
Can you read Greek?
